name: QuickBooks General Journal Entry File
summary: Learn about .QBJ files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: QuickBooks General Journal Entry files were first introduced in 2013. They allow you to manually record data which is useful when important information is not automatically collected by QuickBooks.
NOTE: You can convert .CSV files to the QBJ format with the CSV2QBJ utility offered by ProperSoft.

description: General Journal Entry file used by QuickBooks, a professional financial accounting program; contains manually-recorded transactions, or transfers, of amounts between accounts; may include the accounts, customers, and employees associated with the data, as well as memos and reports.
